----- Original Message -----
From: Tom Helm
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, June 14, 2007 12:30 AM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Kiyomune


Token Kantei Hiketsu doesn't say much about Kiyomune. On the Niô it
has this to say in part;

"Tachi no sugata haba semaku, kasane atsushi, (shodai Kiyozane) ooku
wa sugu-ha ni yakutari, ni dai-mei wa midare ha ni shite nie komaka
ni, boshi maruku, kaeri fukaku, hi o kakitaru mono ooshi. nakago wa
mijikaku, mune wa koniku ni shite ha no ho mo onaji, katayama gata
nari..."
Among the images in this section it shows a handrawn oshigata of
Kiyomune, and though it is far from photographic it shows that his
yasuri-mei was katte-sagari, the mune on his nakago was kaku and he
used kurijiri instead of the more characteristic katayama.
Tsunaishi in Nihonto no Kantei to Kansho breaks it down into Ko-Niô
and Sue Niô school and has a good two pages of info, however Kiyomune
is not mentioned and does not appear in his "family tree" for this
school.
I have added two scans to my new folder, Nihontoryu in the photos
section along with some photos of sutff I saw in Japan on a recent
trip but unrelated to this or any other thread...
-t

PS check the English edition of Token Bijutsu issues 13 and 42 for
info on Kiyozane

has this to say in part;

"Tachi no sugata haba semaku, kasane atsushi, (shodai Kiyozane) ooku

ni, boshi maruku, kaeri fukaku, hi o kakitaru mono ooshi. nakago wa

Among the images in this section it shows a handrawn oshigata of

Tsunaishi in Nihonto no Kantei to Kansho breaks it down into Ko-Niô

I have added two scans to my new folder, Nihontoryu in the photos

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Kiyomune
messages.msgSnippet: Tom I have a tanto that looks to be signed Nio Kiyomune (not the easiest to read) , it is in shirasaya with sayagaki by Kawaguchi Noburo, the sayagaki says the
messages.messageBody:
Tom

I have a tanto that looks to be signed Nio Kiyomune (not the easiest to read) , it is in shirasaya with sayagaki by Kawaguchi Noburo, the sayagaki says the sword is Nio Kiyomune and Bunmei era, sayagaki is dated 1937 (i think, will have to check)........ anyway, Kiyomune is an obscure smith, but i thought there might be a slight chance this sword may have been in one of his books -- i was thinking that if he had the sword in his possession he may have taken an oshigata and as he was publishing reference books in that period maybe he included it...

If anyone does have any info on this smith, or a reference oshigata i would appreciate any help

Mark Jones
nixe@...

Since this has come to the attention of all, would you mind letting

-t

Elliott

messages.messageBody:
To Mark Jones if you are watching.........

I looked for the Mei (Kiyomune) you sent me in the 'TOKEN MEI JITEN'
and could not find it. I also checked the 'Zuikan' and could not find
it there either. I am sure my procedure is correct, but then I am still
very 'green' at the amount of research one needs to do.

Sorry I couldn't be of more help,

Elliott
